events.name: GDG Cloud Jacksonville 1st meetup
events.description:
This will be the first meetup of GDG Cloud Jacksonville and it will be mainly a meet and greet with a intro to docker.

https://docs.docker.com/install/

Requirements:
Bring your laptop and try to have docker already installed.
If you don't have docker installed I will walk through the process.

Agenda:
Docker installation.
Image creation.
Deployment
events.how_to_find_us: Building 200, first floor.  Enter through the North side door because the main entrance locks at six

events.name: Intro to docker swarm
events.description:
I will introduce docker swarm and all of its capabilities.
Some of the topics I will cover:
docker build
docker swarm init
docker swarm join
docker node ls
docker-compose
docker network create
docker service create
docker service inspect
docker service scale (global and regular)
docker service update

Bring you laptop so that you can follow along.
events.how_to_find_us: Please walk around to the right side of the building to enter.

events.name: Cloud Study Jam with Kubernetes and Quiklabs
events.description:
Cloud Study Jam 2019:
Quiklabs has been kind enough to give us some credits to practice Kubernetes on Google Cloud Platform. Specifically we are going to tackle the course Orchestrating the Cloud with Kubernetes. This is completely free for anyone who wants to participate. All you need to do is bring your laptop and I will help out if you run into any problems during the lab. Feel free to leave a discussion post on this page if you have any questions.

On the day of the event I will hand out a link that will give you access to the labs plus 30 additional days to keep learning.
events.how_to_find_us: Please use the side door to enter the building.  If you are standing at the front its around to the right.

upcoming.name: Cloud Code and VScode
upcoming.description: Cloud Code and how to use it to extend vscode to Google Cloud. I will have a few examples to go over. You will need to have an account with GCP to allow this to work. Trail accounts are free while giving you $300 in credit to play around. At the end I will open it up for discussion for anyone who is working on a project that wants to share.

group_profile.intro: I am Google Cloud certified with a passion for docker-compose, proxmox, reverse proxies, golang and powershell.
